mbohanes.bio:
This is the journey of a Solo B2B Consultant reaching $500k revenue / year
(or a partnership reaching $500k per partner): 👇

$𝟎 → 𝟏𝟎𝟎𝐤: Sell something to someone, mainly by getting the basics right 
$𝟏𝟎𝟎 → 𝟐𝟓𝟎𝐤: Can be reached on reputation & referrals alone. Alternatively: Building basic client acquisition systems: Some outbound, regular content
$𝟐𝟓𝟎 → 𝟓𝟎𝟎𝐤: Solidifying & outsourcing client acquisition systems & narrowing down Offer and Client Persona (more scalable)
$𝟓𝟎𝟎𝐤 → 𝟏𝐦*: …

This is the journey we take our clients on. Wherever you are, we help you get to the next level. 

🏭 𝐖𝐇𝐀𝐓 𝐖𝐄 𝐃𝐎 and 👨 𝐖𝐇𝐎 𝐖𝐄 𝐒𝐄𝐑𝐕𝐄 👩
We work with small Consulting firms and B2B Solopreneurs.
We help them 
✅ build client acquisition systems
✅ stop depending on referrals
✅ reach $500k revenue per year (per person, if it’s a partnership)

We have worked with over 100 clients. 
And every single one of them who followed our playbook 
…got at least a 300% ROI within six months (many got way more than that)

🥂 𝐑𝐄𝐒𝐔𝐋𝐓𝐒 
𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐚 𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐚 - from employee to marketing agency owner - closed her first $4k client within 6 weeks
"That clarity I got in our first session was worth the entire investment"
𝐋𝐢𝐳 𝐃𝐨𝐭𝐞𝐧 - closed her first $5k coaching client (who paid on the call) within 5 days of working with us 
“I can’t believe what just happened, happened!”
𝐓𝐨𝐧𝐲 𝐖𝐢𝐥𝐬𝐨𝐧 - did the work and signed his first $5k/month retainer client via outbound within 2 months
𝐉𝐚𝐬𝐨𝐧 𝐊𝐮 - grew his 15-people B2B startup by 50% within a year
𝐋𝐢𝐧𝐚 𝐄𝐫𝐞𝐳 - almost doubled her design agency revenue within 6 months

Many more on: www.alphaleadacademy.com (scroll down to the Testimonials section)

🧪 𝐇𝐎𝐖 𝐃𝐎 𝐖𝐄 𝐃𝐎 𝐈𝐓?
We help you implement a set of proven systems, inbound & outbound (no ads!) 
…where you just do the work to book calls with ideal prospects (and close them)

Best part - we work on a pay-on-results basis, so if you don’t make money, we don’t make money. 
The risk is 100% on our end, so we’re on the hook to get you the results 😬.

Curious how that works and how on EARTH we could be making such a crazy offer? 
Go to www.alphaleadacademy.com (sorry, you’ll have to copy-paste this one)

I see you over there!
Much love
Michal

rahulgnani.headline: 🚀 Identity Innovator | Cloud Alchemist @ Radiant Logic 🌟
rahulgnani.bio:
As a passionate Cloud Engineer with 8+ years of experience, I thrive on solving complex challenges and optimizing cloud infrastructures. My journey began with a fascination for technology and a desire to harness the cloud's power to drive business innovation.

Throughout my career, I've spearheaded multiple cloud migration projects, slashing operational costs by 30% and enhancing system reliability for Fortune 500 companies. My expertise in AWS and Azure, coupled with proficiency in Terraform and Kubernetes, enables me to architect scalable, secure cloud solutions tailored to diverse business needs

Key Achievements:
• Led a team to implement a cloud-native architecture, boosting application performance by 50% while ensuring industry compliance
• Orchestrated a seamless migration of 100+ legacy applications to a hybrid cloud environment, resulting in a 40% reduction in infrastructure costs and 99.99% uptime
• Designed and implemented a robust disaster recovery solution, reducing Recovery Time Objective (RTO) from 24 hours to 2 hours

I'm driven by the ever-evolving nature of cloud technology and its potential to revolutionize businesses. My approach combines technical acumen with strategic thinking, allowing me to bridge the gap between complex cloud solutions and tangible business outcomes.

Specialties:
• Cloud Platforms: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
• Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, CloudFormation
• Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes
• CI/CD: Jenkins, GitLab CI
• Scripting: Python, Bash
• Monitoring: Prometheus, Grafana
• Security: IAM, VPCs, Security Groups

Beyond technical skills, I'm a strong advocate for knowledge sharing and team collaboration. I regularly contribute to open-source projects and mentor aspiring cloud professionals, believing that collective growth strengthens our entire industry.

When not immersed in cloud architectures, I'm an avid hiker and amateur photographer, finding inspiration in nature's intricate systems – much like the complex cloud ecosystems we build.

I'm always eager to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, potential collaborators, or anyone interested in discussing cloud strategies. Whether you're looking to optimize your cloud infrastructure, explore emerging technologies, or simply chat about the future of cloud computing, I'd love to hear from you
rahulgnani.current_role: Senior Cloud Engineer at Radiant Logic

aasitshah.bio:
Dr. Aasit Shah
MD, eQuinoxx House of Art • Design • Films

Aasit Shah is a multi-faceted personality who has been felicitated by several global and Indian universities, media houses and organizations owing to his leadership skills and creative vision. Hailed as the ‘Creative Icon of India’, his efforts made an instrumental impact on the growth of Art & Design industry in India.

An alumnus of University of Southern California, he is an esteemed Silicon Valley veteran who has worked with Adobe Systems & eBay before returning to India with a plan to revolutionize the creative industry. Honored with an ‘Honorary Doctorate’ by the University of Azteca in Los Angeles, Aasit is the brainchild and creative force behind eQuinoxx, the leading design hub in the country.

Holding important executive board positions in Gujarat Chamber of Commerce (GCCI) and JITO, he has been awarded among ‘Men of the Year’ by Times Group in 2018 & 2019 along with several prestigious recognitions, over the years. His knowledge and stronghold over creative aspects nurture his enigmatic personality, driving creativity across the eQuinoxx Group.

For his dynamic vision & immense expertise in the field of Art-Design-Films, Aasit was conferred with ‘Estrellas’ Award by Divya Bhaskar Group in 2018. Also featured on the Cover Page of a popular international magazine - SiliconIndia in 2018. Earlier he was awarded by Times of India as ‘Icon of Gujarat’ in 2017 & by Divya Bhaskar in 2012 as the ‘Young Turk/GenNext Entrepreneur of Gujarat’ for his business-ideas & being an inspiration for the new age.

Featured on Radio on MYFM’s My Icon Show as well as interviewed by Gujarat TV, Mantavya News, Ahmedabad Times, Economic Times, City Bhaskar as well as Mumbai Mirror publications.

He’s also been invited by Nirma School of Management, Adani Institute of Infrastructure Management, United World Business School, Ahmedabad University, GLS School of Management, B.K School of Management, DPS School & Gujarat Technological University (GTU) for Keynote talks on Entrepreneurship, Branding-Marketing & as a Jury for judging various Competitions.

upperwal.headline: Building foundation language models for Indian languages | Founder at Soket Labs | IISc Bangalore
upperwal.bio:
Entrepreneur during the day, Engineer at night.

Abhishek is a Data Scientist by profession and CEO by the needs with a total of 8+ years of experience in various roles. His personal vision is to advance the field of AI that can ultimately contribute towards solutions for social issues. This is reflected in the vision of his startup, Soket Labs.

He started his professional life as a freelance web developer, which transitioned into a design studio startup. He has done his post-graduation in Computational and Data Sciences from Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, specialising in High-Performance Computing and Distributed Systems. 

He has work experience in various big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Giraph, and various distributed systems or Blockchain technologies like Ethereum and Libp2p. 

He has also been engaged with the smart cities mission initially as a fellow for building a DataSpace for smart cities to streamline their data management capabilities through data processing pipelines and creating data standards for urban mobility. He has worked with the Data and Management Unit as a Data Scientist to support various data initiatives in the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs and National Institute of Urban Affairs. He co-lead the Wastewater Intelligence Network Program which aims to institutionalise Wastewater-based Epidemiology for healthcare surveillance and use of data for decision making in pandemic management.
companies: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
upperwal.current_role: CEO / Founder at Soket AI Labs

ruthu-srihari-6717b2195.bio: The thing that fascinates me is that how a bunch of fried potatoes were put in a red and yellow holder and became a global addiction. I am Ruthu Srihari am a BBA graduate from Centre of management studies, Bangalore. I have completed Level 4 in "Applied marketing" from Chartered Institute of Marketing from London and have completed a course on "Market Research and Consumer Behavior" from IE Business School. I have co-authored and published a research paper called " Marketing Practices during Covid 19 in India" in the Aegaeum journal from Belgium which is under the UGC care. I have also created an e-commerce website about automobiles from the Czech Republic for the International management day at my college. I am really keen on marketing and the different aspects of marketing and it is my college major as well. The huge billboards with models flaunting their pieces of art, a bar of soap looking like a perfect spa dream, and even a bar of small bar chocolate satisfying a bunch of hungry people always caught my attention and got me thinking about how a simple yet intricate concept of marketing can build millions of businesses. I was a content writer and a digital marketing intern at DHS informatics, Envitest, Omegaon. I am currently working as a content manager at M56 Studios. I also have prepared quizzes about food, sports, entertainment, history, books, and many more. I write a lot of poems and stories and I'm good at expressing feelings well. I am very interested in psychology and I have studied for 6 months of organizational psychology. I'm really creative in developing new ideas for sales marketing and promotion. I'm open to learning more and I am a fast teacher as well. My communication is not only through words but with my actions. I can really manage a team. I worked in the hospitality and logistics team in my college for one year. I'm not only good at leadership or in organizing but I'm good at doing what people really want. I can do good to the team members and also others. My hobbies are cooking, painting, writing, and painting. I have a keen interest in the food industry and learn about food every day. I'm great at connecting with people with whom I share common interests and food is my way to do that.

shreya-agarwal510.name: Shreya Agarwal
shreya-agarwal510.headline:
all things content and audience | 
ex-head of FilterCopy
shreya-agarwal510.bio:
I love using audience insights, data and creativity to shape narratives and behaviors. And I've spend the last decade doing exactly that - not just by creating content, but by building organic distribution, systems, communities, teams, and the content thesis behind it. 

I started at a digital agency in 2015 when brands were just waking up to social media. I gained early exposure to digital platforms, audience behavior and metrics and very quickly, found merit in working on content that found its own audience, without marketing spends. 

I joined Pocket Aces in 2017 (FilterCopy, Dice Media, Gobble, Nutshell) as a founding member and set up and scaled branded content from scratch - before it became a buzzword :) I then went on to lead Content Strategy across our fiction and non-fiction channels. 

Eventually, I headed FilterCopy, one of India’s most loved youth content platforms, scaling it to 3B+ annual organic views and a 20M+ audience across YouTube, Instagram, Facebook and Snapchat, organically and profitably, with a team I am still proud of! 

I've produced 15+ high-retention IPs (social and OTT), content amassing 10B+ organic views, worked with 300+ brands - guiding them not just on what content to make, but how to measure the real impact of storytelling, beyond views.

I am always looking for more ways to bring the audience to the right content! Love talking all things audience, platforms, communities, Kdramas and content :)

harshmeel.name: Harsh Meel
harshmeel.headline: Engineering Solutions for the Climate Challenge | Researching Geoengineering & Clean Energy Grid @ Cornell | Cornell MS'26 | IIT Bombay '23 | FSAE
harshmeel.bio: Hey, I am a graduate researcher at Cornell, passionate about leveraging engineering and computational tools to tackle the climate challenge of this century. My work spans geoengineering and renewable energy grid modeling I am currently researching Stratospheric Aerosol Injection in the Climate Engineering group and clean energy grid optimization for New York State in the Anderson Lab. In effect, a clean grid helps prevent a climate emergency, while geoengineering explores last-resort solutions to stabilize Earth's climate if we fall short. I started out in hardware prototyping and design with Formula Student, but over time, my focus shifted toward computational modeling, optimization, and climate science. This blend of hands-on and analytical experience helps me approach problems from both a technical and systems-level perspective. Im currently looking for internship opportunities in places where I can grow and apply my skills in modeling, optimization, energy systems and climate dynamics to real-world climate challenges. Check out my academic website to learn more about my work! https://harshmeel.github.io/
education: St. Marys' Sr. Sec. School, Sikar
companies: Cornell University College of Agriculture and Life Sciences

sipraroy.name: Sipra Roy Halteman
sipraroy.headline: Growth & Marketing Leader | Working Mom
sipraroy.bio:
I’m a marketing leader with 17+ years of experience helping brands grow—from early-stage startups to Fortune 500s—across the U.S., Europe, and Asia.

I’ve led global teams, launched performance marketing strategies, built brands from scratch, and helped high-growth companies scale from early-stage to eight-figure revenue with clarity and intention.

But what truly drives me is the why behind the work: building meaningful things with good people—and creating impact that lasts beyond the campaign.

I come from an immigrant family and stepped into a leadership role early in life. That shaped how I show up today: with grit, creativity, and a deep sense of ownership—in work and in life.

Professionally, I care deeply about:
✨ Growth strategy that’s both creative and data-driven
✨ Leading with clarity, calm, and care
✨ Building strong, resilient teams that do work they’re proud of

Personally, I’ve learned the power of sharing what’s real—especially the harder parts.
If anything I’ve experienced can help someone else feel less alone, more seen, or more supported in their own journey… I’m here for that too.

I’m not here to be perfect—just real.
And if what I share helps even one person grow, that’s enough for me.

Additional:
Fluent in Spanish, conversational in Bengali.
Relevant international experience in the U.S., Europe, and Asia.

spandan-roy-644a7142.bio: I am an Assistant Professor at the Robotics Research Center in IIIT Hyderabad (IIITH). I broadly work in the area of nonliear control theory and their applications in Euler-Lagrange systems: more specifically, my research areas include adaptive-robust control, artificial time delay based control design, switched systems and their applications in robotics (I have also worked on other systems other than robots with my collaborators). My lab is well equipped robotic experimental facilities (see the recent works) and my research group always has space for motivated, hard-working people (long-term interns, potential MS(R) and PhD students). Prospective research students may check IIITH website for admission or directly contact me.

esperchawah.headline: Certified Training Manager/Director
esperchawah.bio:
Currently as a Training & Certification consultant with decades of experience in the field, I help organizations build high-stakes, legally defensible certification programs that align with their business objectives and customer needs. I provide consulting services and guidance on best-practices and processes, such as role definition, job task analysis, blueprinting, item writing, analysis and monitoring.

Previously, I was a Certification Program Manager at Cloudera, where I redesigned and relaunched the Cloudera Certification Program (CDP) for cloud and data professionals. I developed and documented exam development processes ensuring reliability, validity, and legal defensibility. I designed and developed four exams in one year, covering different roles and technologies. I also have experience as a Director of Customer Training at Vena Solutions, where I led a team that delivered high-quality, instructor-led and eLearning programs with high learner satisfaction. I updated the curriculum strategy to create more efficient, role-based learner paths, and implemented a standardized training delivery methodology for increased consistency.

I am certified as a Training Manager/Director by Langevin Learning Services, and I am pursuing a BEd in Adult and Continuing Education and Teaching from Brock University. I have strong skills in customer relationship management, people management, training and development, certification and accreditation program management, curriculum design, strategic planning, needs analysis, and adult learning principles. I am passionate about creating and delivering impactful learning and certification solutions that enable learners to achieve their goals and advance their careers.

ashishkolvalker.headline: HR Leader & Consultant | Coach | People, Culture, Leadership
ashishkolvalker.bio:
I am passionate about helping both individuals and organizations become more effective at what they do!

I enjoy working on assignments & roles which help build people strategy, build capable leaders, and effective, high performing teams.

- As a Consultant, I advise organizations in People Strategy, Performance, Culture, Change, Leadership Development & Org Effectiveness. I bring several years of experience as a global HR Leader. 
- As a Coach, I partner with individuals who feel they are 'stuck' in their personal or professional lives - corporate leaders, managers, founders / entrepreneurs. I am a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation (ICF). I coach on careers, cross-culture integration and effectiveness, performance, leadership & executive presence, emotional intelligence, life & well-being and relationships.

I am reachable at ashish.kolvalker@gmail.com. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Read more about my experiences below:

HR Leadership & Consulting:
As an HR leader, I have led HR teams & driven transformation journeys globally. I enjoy partnering with business leaders & help them 'win from a People Strategy' perspective. I have led global projects in Leadership Development, Talent Management, Performance Management, HR Technology, Rewards, OD, L&D & Culture. My experience pans European markets (Germany, France, UK, Croatia, Spain), APAC and US. 

Leadership Development & Coaching:
I have worked with more than 200 Leaders / Managers / Founders & partnered to help achieve maximum potential. As a Leadership Development expert, I have led many projects & facilitated workshops for more than 1000 Managers & Leaders. I am an assessor for hiring and developing leaders. I am certified on tools like Hogan, DISC, OPQ.

As a Corporate HR leader:
I have worked with entrepreneur-led early-stage organizations & large, matrixed MNCs (Tech, Manufacturing, Insurance, Consulting, etc.). In my last role, I led HR globally for a B2B SaaS Tech org, reported into two CEOs over 5 years, and helped them grow five-fold to a unicorn valuation. I helped scale the organization in EMEA & US, and managed acquisitions across US & Europe. I have also hired and mentored HR teams globally by building strong HR competencies. 

Education: BE (Computers), MBA (Human Resources), SHRM-SCP

I write actively in the space of People & Culture (do read my articles in the Publications section below).

If you are someone looking for some quick mentoring, reach me on TopMate: https://topmate.io/ashishkolvalker
education: Padre Conceicao College of Engineering, Verna (PCCE)
Padmashri Vasantrao Dhempe Higher Secondary School of Arts & Science, Panaji, Goa

snehanshusaha.name: Snehanshu Saha
snehanshusaha.headline: Professor, Dept. of CSIS, BITS Goa and Head-Anuradha and Prashanth Palakurthi Centre for Artificial Intelligence Research (APPCAIR-All Campuses of BITS Pilani), Head-IKA (All Campuses of BITS Pilani); F-IETE
snehanshusaha.bio:
I focus on developing a strong theory group on Machine learning and Deep Learning, specifically addressing the complex issue of optimization in Learning and attempting to unfold the ‘black-box’ deep learning techniques. I develop methods in Computational Learning Theory (COLT) and Mathematics of Data Science (MDS) Techniques and focus on building Pointwise smooth approximations of gradient, discovering activation functions from data, smoothness and convexity studies of loss functions, methods in interpretable deep learning, novel loss functions in back-propagation, Chaos-causality in Deep Neural Networks and pruning/compression in Deep Networks. My Goals include Efficient, reliable and robust Inferences (One Landscape) via tools such as Measure Theory, Non-Linear Optimization, Functional Analysis, Econometrics and Dynamical Systems. I apply the methods to solve problems in Biology, Healthcare, AstroInformatics (AIM), Transportation, and other Social good applications (AML).
Recent Notable Publications (2022-23):
1. N.Arya, A. Mathur, Sriparna Saha, S.Saha; Improving the Robustness and Stability of a Machine Learning Model for Breast Cancer Prognosis through the use of Multi-Modal Classifiers; Scientific
Reports (Nature) [Q1, I.F: 5]
2. N.Arya, A. Mathur, S.Saha, Sriparna Saha; Proposal of SVM Utility Kernel for Breast Cancer Survival Estimation; IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics [Q1, I.F: 3.74]
3. J.Sarkar. S.Saha, S.Sarkar; Efficient Anomaly Identification in Temporal and Non-Temporal Industrial Data using Tree Based Approaches; Applied Intelligence [Q1, I.F: 5.4]
4. Aishwarya. M, V.Raychoudhury, S. Saha, S.Kar, Anusha. K, CARE-Share: A Cooperative and Adaptive Ride Strategy for Distributed Taxi Ride Sharing, IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems [Q1, I.F: 9.98]
5. A. Tambewkar, A. Maiya, Soma.S. Dhavala and S.Saha; Estimation and Applications of Quantiles in Deep Binary Classification; IEEE Transactions on Artificial Intelligence
6. Tejas Prashanth, Snehanshu Saha, Sumedh Basarkod, Suraj Aralihalli, Soma S Dhavala, Sriparna Saha, and Raviprasad Aduri; LipGene: Lipschitz continuity guided adaptive learning rates for fast convergence on Microarray Expression Data Sets’ [Q1, I.F: 3.74]
7. Rohan Mohapatra, Snehanshu Saha, Carlos A. Coello Coello, Anwesh Bhattacharya, Soma S. Dhavala and Sriparna Saha; AdaSwarm: Augmenting gradient-based optimizers in Deep Learning with Swarm Intelligence, the IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence [Q1, I.F: 4.9]
education: The University of Texas at Arlington

prashbohra.name: Prashant Bohra
prashbohra.headline: Founder and CEO | Start-up Mentor and Advisor| Angel Investor | JITO-JITEM National Convenor| JITO-JIIF Member| GTM Strategist, Health and HealthTech Consultant.
prashbohra.bio:
With over 25 years of experience in the health and pharmaceutical industries, I have honed my skills in strategic initiatives, P&L management, and digital marketing. Currently, I lead Strategic and Business Development Initiatives at BJW Health Private Limited, focusing on P&L management and driving innovation in healthcare delivery. My expertise lies in building profitable and sustainable businesses, planning go-to-market (GTM) strategies and executing brand-building strategies and digital marketing campaigns that yield measurable success.

Professional Journey
My career began in the pharmaceutical sector, where I developed a strong foundation in sales, marketing, and networking. Over the years, I have successfully built, developed, and executed numerous brand-building strategies and digital marketing campaigns, consistently delivering measurable results. My ability to leverage digital platforms has been instrumental in enhancing patient care and provider outreach.

At BJW Health Private Limited, we have developed two patented and innovative brands that address key challenges in controlling infections in hospital setups.

Reliance Retail's Netmeds: Partnered with Netmeds to apply my competencies in digital and performance marketing, optimizing market presence and driving substantial growth. Developed Customer Lifecycle Management (CLM) initiatives to build long-term associations, impacting success and stickiness. Our collaborative efforts have positioned us at the forefront of digital marketing in the healthcare and e-commerce segments.

Marketing Consultant: Proven track record in the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectors, leading to company growth and building P&L profitability through sales drivers, strategic initiatives, and digital campaigns that yield measurable success.

Skills and Expertise
- Sustainable and Growth Orientation
- P&L Management
- Driving ROI and Business Impact
- Strategic Initiatives
- Brand-Building Strategies
- Digital Marketing Campaigns

Industry Experience
- Health and Hygiene
- E-Commerce
- Digital Healthcare Solutions

Dedication to Excellence
I am mentor and Advisor to incubation centers, guiding young minds with GTM strategies, networking, and industry connections. With a dedication to excellence and a forward-thinking approach, I am committed to driving growth and innovation in the health sector. My passion for leveraging business growth to build a strong ecosystem has been a cornerstone of my career. I am always seeking new opportunities to collaborate and make a positive impact in the industry.
companies: Nanz Med Science Pharma P Ltd
prashbohra.current_role: Co-Founder and Director at BJW Health Private Limited

bob-guarasci-385043266.name: Bob Guarasci
bob-guarasci-385043266.headline: Chief Executive Officer at New Jersey Community Development Corporation (NJCDC)
bob-guarasci-385043266.bio: In 1994, I asked my colleague Rob Long to join me in creating a new community development organization in the city of Paterson, New Jersey.  We started that year with an AmeriCorps national service program and now serve more than 4,000 children and families each day through services that include several school-based Teen Centers, a youth center, a preschool, after-school programs, a charter school, and a number of other initiatives.  We have also developed more than 200 units of affordable housing and built a number of community spaces, a dozen playgrounds, and our most recent program is a city-wide Financial Empowerment Center operated in partnership with the City of Paterson.  Along the way, we've rehabilitated a number of 100+ year-old buildings where we carry out our work, embracing the importance of historic preservation.
bob-guarasci-385043266.current_role: Chief Executive Officer at New Jersey Community Development Corporation (NJCDC)
